website_summaries.verdict: The Jungle Moc is an easy-to-wear slip-on design made with high-quality materials.
pros: The Junge Moc is a carefully crafted slip on shoe with a generously cushioning liner
The outsole provides traction and even without laces the fit is comfortable and just right
cons: Outsole is a bit less durable than on other Merrell models

customer_reviews.title: These are NOT slip-resistant. AVOID.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get a new pair of non-slip shoes for my restaurant gig, as my last ones have worn out. I love Merrells so I was happy when I saw that they offer a slip-resistant shoe. However, I quickly find out that these are NOT slip-resistant. In fact, they are probably the most slippery pair of shoes I have ever worn. I'm very surprised that no one else has reported this problem. DO NOT buy these for restaurant work, it is a death sentence.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: "Slate Black" is brown and different material
customer_reviews.text: My husband has purchased these shoes for years now. They hold up well and fit well. However, be advised! The Slate Black color is actually brown (see pic), and the material is not suede like ALL the other colors are.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Just a Cheap Knock Off of the Exact Same Shoe Sold in Stores
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair on Amazon to save some money, after trying out a pair of the exact same shoes at Cabelas. Even though Amazon advertises it as the exact same shoe, it actually isn't. The arch in the pair that I bought off of Amazon is further back than in the exact same shoe that I tried on at Cabelas. When I put them on and walked around, it seemed as if I was wearing a pair of women's high heel shoes. In my opinion, the shoe being sold on Amazon, is just a knockoff of the actual product sold in stores.
customer_reviews.author: Gumby #1

customer_reviews.title: After 1 year of everyday wear, I still love these!
customer_reviews.text: First, I should mention that I'm a software engineer so my shoes don't take much abuse on my day-to-day routine. That said, these shoes are still super comfortable and convenient. I wear them every day monday - sunday for almost every activity. I was skeptical of a slip on shoe thinking that over time they'd stretch and fit loosely or something. They still feel great and fit comfortably. They're starting to show some wear - the knobs on the rubber soles are wearing down and there are rub marks from my jeans on the surface of the shoe, but other than that these are still perfect. I'll be ordering a new pair of these to replace my old ones.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cardillo

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This shoe was one of the ones recommended by my podiatrist for Plantar challenges. I did pull the insert and replace it with a ProTech Control orthotic support insole as suggested by my podiatrist for any shoe. I'm truly happy with this pair of shoes. I've had them for a couple of weeks now and gave them a workout on a resent trip to Maine where we even took a short walk on the AP. Nice to have some slip-ons with support again. I'll probably get another pair. Also, I've not waterproofed them as yet (don't know if I will) and they've held up fine even with some rain and walking along some wet, slightly muddy trails.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Amazon sucks
customer_reviews.text: I typed in Waterproof Jungle Moc and this was one of the products that showed up and I ordered it. This product is NOT waterproof. The vendor did great and Amazon did not. These shoes are worthless to me and unfortunately I wore them before I realized these are not what I wanted. My next pair will not be through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Thatguy

customer_reviews.title: 4th pair -- These are great!
customer_reviews.text: From Vern (husband): I've now purchased 4 pairs of these and wear almost nothing else. They are comfortable, water-resistant, and easy to slip on (very important at age 76). They are great for hiking along short trails, and they are a pleasure to wear when walking my dog along the many forest trails in our neighborhood. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer janet

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I am 3 weeks in wearing the shoes. I work 6 days a week and overall the experience have been really good. I ordered a size 9 and it fits good and it has very good arch support. At first, i thought I had to break them in for a couple of days and surprisingly that wasn't the case. It is very comfortable and sometimes it feels like I'm not wearing it at all. There are a 1 thing that I didn't like, which is the alcantara leather because i work with things that involves dust flying left and right and those dusts sticks to the alcantara. Other than that, everything else is excellent
customer_reviews.author: Naga Speed

customer_reviews.title: Meets or exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: Buying shoes sight unseen for me is not something I entered into lightly. After shopping the outlet mall, I decided this would be the best choice for me. The selection through Amazon cannot be matched. So, I ordered what my usual size and selected the color I thought I would like. What I received is exactly what I wanted. These are very stylish and more importantly, comfortable. The tread pattern seems appropriate for 4 seasons, we have snow 4 to 6 months every year and I think I can wear these any time I want. Merrell has a great reputation for quality, my hikers are going on 8 years old and look fantastic. in summary, I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Skipping/Ocean

customer_reviews.title: Standing Hospital Worker Approved
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these shoes. Super comfortable, easy to slip on, hold on well but not too tight, AND form to my feet very well. I work in the emergency department and am on my feet A LOT and these shoes are perfect for it. They grip any floor well, protect your feet from any bodily fluids, the rubber on the bottom is very durable, and the overall construction appears to be more than adequate for a hospital environment. Exactly what I needed and I anticipate they will last a very long time. I have had them for 10 months now and they show no real damage or wear.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: First Pair of the  Suede Leather Mocs to Slip on the Heel.
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing the Suede Leather Jungle Moc for a few years now, and this is the first pair I have worn that Slip Up and Down on the Heel. I experienced the slipping in the heal with the Leather Mocs while trying on at the shoe store and that is why I have gone with The Suede Leather Moc's all these years. Next purchase of these will be done at a shoes store where I can give them a test drive first! I was sadly disappointed with this purchase, but on a brighter note, the Amazon's refund was almost immediate and the return virtually painless.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Not the best shoes I've bought
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a pair of nicer casual slip ons to wear to work. They look nice enough, and the arch support was surprising, but they aren't very comfortable. I have an older pair of jungle mocs that are way more comfortable and softer, but the tread is worn out. These feel like they are cheaper made in comparison. If I hadn't worn them outside I'd return them. Now I can only hope they get more comfortable over time.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: they're fairly comfortable, but this is the least durable shoe I've ...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes turned 2 months old today and are already falling apart. The sole is detaching from the upper near the toe. Right shoe has a full-on hole in the side, and the left shoe is not quite at the hole stage, but the separation is obvious. They fit well, they're fairly comfortable, but this is the least durable shoe I've ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: County Line Tech

customer_reviews.title: Very slippery soles
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have very slippery soles, and I find that they are lightweight and not very rugged for the high price. They fit ok for wearing around the house, but shoes track in mud and dirt. Everything gets stuck in the soles of these shoes and it’s difficult to clean out. You better off with cheap tennis shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great, comfortable shoe. NO traction on trails, mud, etc
customer_reviews.text: I like the fit, the comfort, and the look of this shoe but it is NOT a shoe you'd want to wear on a trail - as advertised. I have rolled my ankle for the first time in my life hiking on a 30 degree slope, in wet weather. I thought it was a combination of factors, but the tread and material doesn't give you any grip on inclined trails, period. If you plan on walking on flatter surfaces, I would recommend, otherwise, I do not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I never had Merrell's before. I really like these shoes. I take a 13 all day long. These 13s fit really well. I think I will shop Merrell's in the future. I have no trouble with the arch support in these shoes like some people do. I wouldn't say that I have a high arch. I suppose it just depends on the person. They don't slip off at the heel. They are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Juppy015

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I've had a pair of Sorels for years, and they were also good but super slippery on wet tile floors. These are not at all slippery. They fit snugly, but still have room in the to (I have a widish foot but not too wide.) I measure right about 9.5 and got the 10s and they are perfect with just enough room in the toe. They are stiff enough that I can slip into them without the back crumpling down, without having to bend over. Great shoes!
customer_reviews.author: David Houggy Jr

customer_reviews.title: However he was disappointed that the "Fudge" color is much lighter than shown ...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have been my husband's favorites for several years. However he was disappointed that the "Fudge" color is much lighter than shown online. He expected a dark chocolate brown, but it's more of a dark tan color. The Merrell website also has the color misrepresented, so it isn't the fault of the seller. Still a great shoe, just don't expect a dark brown.
customer_reviews.author: konagal

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoes - great fit and quality!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these based on Merrell's reputation and customer reviews. I had two concerns - the first is whether the shoe was a suede finish or smooth and the second whether the shoe put pressure on my heel (tendonitis). Neither of these is now an issue - the surface is smooth and though the shoe close fitting it does not put any pressure on my achilles tendon. Great looking shoe - very good arch support - great price for the quality. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: wheeezer

customer_reviews.title: My new everyday shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews- great comfort My only issue is the height of the heel. Merrell makes great footwear, so the thickness of the outsole is like their hiking boots. The thickness seems a bit much for a slip-on, as it adds height... ...not a complaint... ...just pointing it out, as you'll be aware of it when you try them on. Now, for obvious reasons... ...the thicker the outsole, the more comfortable the shoes will be in the long run as the sole wears thinner with use. Buy them, you'll never go back to junk like Crocs or Skechers.... ....these are the grown-up shoes I should have been wearing for the last decade
customer_reviews.author: P&E

customer_reviews.title: The Squeaky Shoe Doesn't Respond to Grease
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a fan of Merrell shoes, they're great for walking and look good too, in either home-casual or work-casual situations. I walk 2-5 miles a day, to and from work, so a good pair of Merrells suits both the walk and the office. EXCEPT for this pair of Jungle Mocs. They're shoddily made and the soles squeak like I'm walking on live mouse insoles. I hoped maybe it was just a "new" thing, so I still wore them several times... apparently I hoped too long and now Amazon won't let me return them. I'd like to think this pair was a defective fluke, but I'm afraid Merrell quality may have gone out the window.
customer_reviews.author: cory3d

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as the one's I bought in a store
customer_reviews.text: I saw some reviews that made me a little hesitant to buy these on-line. The first pair I purchased from a store lasted over 3 years, not wearing everyday, but most weekends. That pair eventually became my yard work shoes that I still use to this day. They have great support for a loafer. Probably my favorite shoes for comfort. If you've owned these before, you know they're good. Roll the dice and see if you like them. They can always be returned if they're not what you expected. For the record, I'm big guy and think these will work for all shapes and sizes.
customer_reviews.author: C-Money81

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and stylish
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes tough to get the correct fit when ordering footwear online, and inconvenient to return and exchange when they don't. These Mocs came in the perfect fit. Extremely comfortable, good cushion at the heels, arch support helps with stability when walking on uneven surfaces by helping to keep the foot in line. Lightweight, and the look is great. Highly recommend if you are looking for a comfortable walking around shoe, with good stability and can be worn anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G

customer_reviews.title: wear them every day
customer_reviews.text: great comfortable shoe, wear them 98% of the time: for working on concrete all day, semi water proof when walking in the rain, and surprisingly support my weak ankles as well,. (but don't use them for sports, just everyday wear and light hiking). although I do wear them hunting in warmer weather ( as they are not insulated and were not said to be) I weigh 350 lbs and get over 6 months wear before changing inner soles & get another 3 to 6 months depending on the inner sole used.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Hammons

customer_reviews.title: These are very comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: I've worn this style of shoe for at least a couple of decades. I keep ordering them because they are so comfortable, yet give me good support. I like that I can slip my foot into them without having to hold any kind of heel strap. They don't fold over and collapse the way some other shoes do when you try that. That's true for the life of the shoes. For me, it's the soles that eventually wear out, not the uppers. I'm not saying the soles are bad, I'm saying the uppers are good. These shoes last a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Aero-Mech

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband. He has foot issues and wears shoe inserts. Took the chance and bought these off Amazon. He really likes them. Bought the usual size 10 for him. He wears them everyday. He was pleasantly surprised the other day when he had to go up on the roof at work and there was over 2 inches of water. His feet didn't get wet! He was impressed. If these shoes hold up as the reviews say they do we are sold on them.
customer_reviews.author: mvanfos

customer_reviews.title: Back to basics
customer_reviews.text: This is a great street shoe for someone who commutes in urban areas and walks in all weather. I wear a women's 12 wide normally, but since Merrell women's shoes only go up to 11, I buy the men's mocs. I have owned several pairs over the years. I wear them out completely, look for something more feminine in other brands for a while (those shoes fall apart pretty quickly and, who am I kidding? I have big feet), then go back to this same style because I can count on it. It has a slightly higher arch than I need, but it's a shoe that I can count on. Wearing them makes me want to keep walking.
customer_reviews.author: ellemirell

customer_reviews.title: For the concrete jungle!
customer_reviews.text: These fit great. I now have four colors. I went with these a few months back when I got huge hip pain and could not tie shoelaces. These gave great support when walking the dog during that time. Since that time, I have had a hip replacement and these are even more important to me in my recovery as their support is outstanding. It will be hard for me to go back to any traditional shoe. Merrells are always great and these are a fave. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sockit2me

customer_reviews.title: Rocking from the first step.
customer_reviews.text: Rocking from the first step. With trashed feet these are comfortable from the get go and grip like there is no tomorrow. I suffer from plantar fasciitis and neuropathy so comfort is very hard to come by and these fill the bill. Thanks Merrell for another stellar product. As I live in Colorado and spend more then a few days in the outdoors these are much more then a camp shoe, good looking, great fit and tons of utility. An ATV disguised as a casual slip on.
customer_reviews.author: Dean K. Winn

customer_reviews.title: Love these supportive shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These are the only shoes that support my high arches without orthotics right out of the box. I have plantar fasciitis and usually either have to put in orthotic support or at least some gel arch supports but not with these. Love them for slip on garden shoes and work shoes when I am on my feet all day. They are my go to winter shoe. I have 2 pair and I wish they made them in a mesh upper for summertime.....perhaps they do...I'll have to look when summer rolls around.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa L.

customer_reviews.title: Love my Jungle Mocs!
customer_reviews.text: I am a woman with large feet (size 12). I have been wearing Merrell Jungle Mocs for several years now. Every time I get a new pair, I also purchase Superfeet insoles to improve the support. The Jungle Mocs are the most comfortable shoes I have ever worn, and they last me about a year, with almost daily wear. They are easy to get on and off, easy to clean, and have good tread. I hope Merrell never discontinues this shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Marcia G

customer_reviews.title: "Fudge" is not Dark Brown like in pictures!
customer_reviews.text: "Fudge" Color is WAY lighter than in stock photos. In photos it appears dark brown but in reality it's a very lite brown that looks grey at times. The color is SO light I returned my first pair believing I was given "castle rock" in error. Could be I had because this pair is definitely brown unlike previous pair but I can see how the 2 could easily have been accidentally switched. If this pair hadn't come factory shrink wrapped unlike 1st pair I'd never believe it's "fudge" Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I used to buy Merrell's all the time...but now I am worried..
customer_reviews.text: This is so frustrating...I have bought this type of Merrell shoe many times...and they would slip on and fit perfectly from the box--I loved them--- This year I was replacing my old pair with exactly the same shoe..same size..same color...and I bought 2 pairs as they had a good deal....however both pairs have exactly the same problem. They pinch on the left shoe around the ankle...so much so that it is also impossible to use them. I thought that maybe stretching them may make things better and even walking in them to break them in...but it hasn't worked... so frustrating...
customer_reviews.author: Mark 1

customer_reviews.title: No shoe laces to tie . . . Comfortable all purpose shoes
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, nice looking, easy to slip on and take off. I can wear these shoes for almost all occasions except formal affairs. They are not water proof, but they have rubber souls, so they are fine on all surfaces. I hike with them, mow the grass, go out to dinner, go to the office, truly all purpose comfortable shoes.
customer_reviews.author: R. Platten

customer_reviews.title: Merrell's Jungle Moc's again!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Merrells' Jungle Moc's as my go-to day shoe for nearly 8 years now - I think this purchase was either my 3rd of 4th pair. I was first turned on to Merrell's by a nurse who swore by them as a show you could spend all day in. I was about to embark on 8 months backpacking through Central & South America, so I took a punt. So glad I did! They lasted me all of that trip, and a couple of years after. I've been buying them ever since!
customer_reviews.author: Shaun H.

customer_reviews.title: Redesigned???
customer_reviews.text: The arch supplies way too high and hurts my feet. My last pair of Merrels were exactly the same model style but the arches were much more comfortable. I have to return these.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Maramara

customer_reviews.title: Love Merrel
customer_reviews.text: I've had a very nice pair of leather slip-ons for almost 15 years. They've had holes in the soles for at least 5. I've not been able to find another pair of slip-ons as comfortable for years and years. Others are either too loose, cheaply made, or have crappy soles. I've had a pair of Merrell light weight hiking boots forever. They are amazingly comfortable. Why I didn't think to try Merrell slip-on shoes sooner I don't know. These are perfect. Love them. Love Merrell.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, easy to slip on
customer_reviews.text: I've had a problem with my knee bending, so decided to try these slip-ons instead. To be honest, I'm quite pleased. I can put them on without bending my knee using a long shoe horn and they are comfortable enough to wear throughout the day in normal operation. I've yet to walk any long distances in them, but so far so good...comfortable, relatively attractive, and not too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley A Kohn Jr

customer_reviews.title: Good quality shoe for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I have very wide feet (going barefooted) and it is hard to find shoes that actually fit and are comfortable, this pair of shoes turned out excellent. Was a little concerned about the size to order. Ended up ordering 1/2 size larger than my norm but it worked out well. Have worn them with socks and without socks and very pleased with the shoes. I will definitely consider Merrell's shoes in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Jim

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love Merrell shoes. I bought a pair of these about 8 years back and I haven't bought any other brand of shoes since. I work as a delivery guy and my feet would hurt nearly every day from carrying heavy parcels. I tried multiple brands of shoes and insoles, but these shoes are the only thing that seemed to cure my achy feet and lower back after a long day. I also bought them for my wife, and mom and they love them. It really is worth it to put a little extra money into quality shoes and avoid the pain of being on your feet all day. We don't really wear anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Run 1/2 size large; heel height too high for me
customer_reviews.text: Hm, for me these seem to run 1/2 size large. I usually buy size 11 shoes, and from most companies. These have more room, so I could try 10.5. I am not sure about the feel on the foot, it does have good arch support, but the heel feels VERY high - maybe the heel-toe offset is 14 mm or higher? It feels strange, I prefer it maybe 8 or 10 mm, just a touch above flat. The sole is very grippy and seems to have a ton of traction. They are nice looking and easy to slip on, with a little elastic around the top area/tongue where you put your foot in.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Tight and slippery
customer_reviews.text: I love Merrell slip ons. Great for my dog hikes in the mid atlantic woods, bbut these are just too snug, and I'm not sure what has happened to the sole bc these are slippery! I cross a creek daily with my dog stepping from stone to stone to get across and have never slipped in previous Merrells after hundreds of times, but in these I have slipped 2X! Has something changed in the treads and rubber?
customer_reviews.author: Roger G. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great, Comfortable and Good-Looking Footwear
customer_reviews.text: These are my third pair of Merrell Mocs. They are the most comfortable shoe I have ever worn, and last a long, long time. They are easy to slip on, and unlike other slip-on shoes , the heel does not collapse over time. And because the manufacturer makes a size fourteen, they are easy to find. The shoe provides the support and comfort needed to walk on concrete and other hard surfaces. They look good and are ideal for business casual dress. I actually use them to do my one-mile daily walk. They are that comfortable. Well worth the money because they last and last.
customer_reviews.author: Pfred

customer_reviews.title: These shoes rock!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has very wide feet. Ordered one half size larger, wide width. Oh so comfy. He had gained some weight so that’s why we ordered a bit larger. In the past reg. size was fine. These shoes last forever! He wears them to work and you can’t ask for a better product. Appreciate these shoes so much! Happy feet, happy husband🤗🤗🤗
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: ** Perfect Shoe ***
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoe. The hard part was trying to figure out what width. I had to order mine. They were not in stock here in the U.S. But, worth the wait. Love em, fit is great. Very comfortable. Now that I know my size for future purchases I’m good to go. Just buy them. You won’t regret your purchase. Please don’t stop making these shoes. A lot of others try to make these. But other brands just don’t cut it for the fit and comfort. Would I buy them again........... YES ABSOLUTELY!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: BILL

customer_reviews.title: Bad fit
customer_reviews.text: The Merrell fit too snug for me to be comfortable even though I bought half a size higher than what I usually wear. The bright part is, this is consistent with almost every Merrell shoe that I have owned or tried out. I had tried out a larger size hoping that the fit would be better but no luck. Anyway, I think the takeaway for me is that Merrells are never going to be my brand and I can't say I am sorry about that.
customer_reviews.author: Vik

customer_reviews.title: Just a great shoe!!
customer_reviews.text: I really do enjoy wearing this shoe. The fit is just right for me (11D). I like the quality, the look, the leather outer and the rugged sole. They’re easy to slip on, and yet don’t feel sloppy while wearing them. I have two pair and wear them regularly, even to work at times! My job has me on my feet for over 8 hours a day and these Mocs serve me well the entire time. I do switch out to my Gortex shoes on rainy days.
customer_reviews.author: R.J.Trueman

customer_reviews.title: Warm Dry Comfort
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th pair of these type of Merrell's I have purchased and as always they exceed my expectations. From cold days in Colorado to wet days in Washington DC my feet stay dry warm and comfortable. If dirty I can spray them off with a hose and never get my feet wet. They fit well, wear well, and look good enough to keep be business casual. If you want a great shoe with a great fit and lasts for years without breaking down, get Merrell Moc's!
customer_reviews.author: M. Hush

customer_reviews.title: Snug
customer_reviews.text: I really like Merrill's shoes. I have a job where I am on my feet all day and my feet were regularly hurting so I got a new pair of shoes. These slip-on and are very comfortable with good arch support. They are a little more casual looking than I would like for work but the comfort is worth it. I would consider spending a few extra dollars to get the waterproofing if you spend a lot of time outdoors. I will purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Z

customer_reviews.title: SQUEAK, SQUEAK, SQUEAK will announce your arrival!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love these shoes as much as one may love a pair of shoes, but they would not let me. First of all, the fit was just a bit too large which allowed them to occasionally turn on their sides on uneven terrain. Yes, that does result in unpleasant ankle twisting! As uncomfortable and annoying as that was, it did not compare to the constant and incredibly annoying squeak that announced my arrival from about fifty feet out (not an exaggeration). Overall they were okay, I guess, but the ankle twisting and tortuously annoying squeak was too much. I returned them for a refund, and that went perfectly smoothly!
customer_reviews.author: Darryl Barker

customer_reviews.title: Loved Them First Step
customer_reviews.text: As soon as the shoe hit the door they were on my feet. Very comfortable. I have chronic back problems and bending over to put on shoes is hard on my back. I use a long slipper spoon and my foot slips in quickly. The shoes are very comfortable. I may order another pair ASAP. I love these shoes so much I reordered another pair. Most shoes come off as soon as I hit the door, these I wear comfortably most of the day.
customer_reviews.author: billhigh67

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable shoes. I bought these as a replacement to ...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoes. I bought these as a replacement to another pair of Merrell Jungle Moc's. The only issue I had with these shoes was they squeaked badly when I first started wearing them. The squeaking was in the sole of the shoe and made this noise with every step. The shoes remained comfortable like my previous pair of Jungle Moc's so I ignored the noise. after several months the squeaking actually stopped. So I gave the shoes a 4 star rating since they started to perform better.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Great Winter Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Well, I love them...I've been through several pair in the last several years. This is the first pair my husband has had. He has chilblains in the winter and his toes blister etc. For years I have tried to get him to wear warmer shoes. One of the many benefits of these shoes (to me) is that they hold your body heat in, and after a while your feet warm up. So I finally insisted that he try these. So far, so good. I ordered a size 11.5; they are a little too long but not enough to trade them for a smaller size; maybe next pair we'll order an 11.
customer_reviews.author: S. Thorp

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I wear size 11 in other Merrell shoes, but these are at least 1 size too large. Also, the arch support is too high and hurts my feet. I returned them. This was the first time I returned anything using the QR code and it worked OK, but I'm not comfortable just handing the merchandise over to the UPS store and not getting a receipt that shows my name, etc. I think I will shop for shoes and clothes locally from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you have a wide width foot this is a good shoe
customer_reviews.text: I work on my feet all day and love wearing this shoe. I’m a woman’s wide width so I bought the men’s shoe and it’s perfect. I wear orthotic inserts so it’s easily to take the bottom out and place my inserts in. In snow I like them for the traction (obviously not deep snow) my last ones lasted almost a year before the bottom started wearing down. I also love how I can slip them on and off easily.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Good walking shoe choice
customer_reviews.text: These mocks are comfortable so far for normal walking and they do not cause any hot spots or blisters that I tend to get. I try to walk between one to two miles 3 days a week and so a good walking shoe is very important to me. Time will tell if it holds up to the usage. I got the light taupe color because of the lower price but I would normally get a dark brown color. The light taupe color will show dirt more and need more cleaning. So far it's a good shoe but only after three weeks use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Merrill Jungle Moc slip on
customer_reviews.text: My husband absolutely loves these shoes. I got him a "cheaper" pair of another brand that is similar looking and they were so hard to put on and take off that it kind of defeated the purpose of having slip ons. I wanted something my husband could easily slip on at the door to wear out and then slip off when he comes back in because he is in and out a lot. These are perfect for that and his feet are very comfortable in them. I got the brown color for him and he loves that too.
customer_reviews.author: Magga Pie

customer_reviews.title: Would Buy Again!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes really live up to their reviews, they are super comfortable and fit as expected. My only issue is in the photo they looked like a light brown but they are more of a silver/grey. It would be helpful if the colors had real names like light tan, light brown, dark brown, etc instead of cutesy color names. But the shoes themselves are great!
customer_reviews.author: Jake C6R

customer_reviews.title: I like Merrill shoes.  This one is no different.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a little heavier Merrill shoe this time and this shoe gave it to me. Of course, I love the slip-on design. I stubbed my toe a little and I noticed it protected well. The sole is thicker too which is better for walking on rocks. Not as cool as my Merrill tennis shoes while riding my bicycle but grips as well. They are just a little heavier shoe than the tennis shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Clark

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, no break-in period, keeps feet warm on cold concrete shop floor
customer_reviews.text: I told my husband I was ordering a pair of these and he wanted a pair, too. He LOVES them! They suede is warm and the sole prevents cold concrete shop floors from transferring to your feet. He really likes the slip-on aspect. He wears them for everything except outside tractor work. No break-in period at all and they are great for his diabetic feet. No rubbing points inside at all.
customer_reviews.author: lemlem

customer_reviews.title: Quality is in the name of this shoe brand.
customer_reviews.text: The first pair I had finally broke down, and my feet were telling me "Hey! It's time for a new pair of Merrells!" If you looked at me old pair, you would not know they were out of commission, the soles are still in really good shape and from looking at them, you'd never know. I had the first pair for about 9 months, and I wore them day in and day out, and they were really nice for traveling and having to take your shoes off at the airport for security. Easy off and easy on, grab your baggage and run for the plane.
customer_reviews.author: PANDA 🐼🐼

customer_reviews.title: Love the fit & Function..but they squeak?!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing these for 5 months and, while very comfortable, they have developed a distinct squeak when walking. It's not sole nor the slip-in liner - seems to be coming from in between the various layers, near the heel ares. It's quite annoying when walking around our quiet office & I'm going to stop wearing them. Is it too late for a refund, I wonder?
customer_reviews.author: B.Ramsay

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe I have ever had. My third pair.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd time I have purchased these shoes, and I'm certain it won't be the last. They give tremendous support for my knees. Without them I can hardly walk due to the pain. I waited too long this time and I was happy when they arrived today. Once again, immediate relief and I recommend them to anyone. They wear very well and the design is great for hiking. If you are looking for a good looking functional casual shoe, you can not go wrong here.
customer_reviews.author: James Transue

customer_reviews.title: Not as comfy as expecting
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because they were recommended for standing long amounts of time (medical student doing surgery rotation). However, for me they did not feel that comfy and didn't help my sore feet. They did fit well, and seemed to made of good quality, but just not for me. I ended up getting some Hokka's, which are super squooshy and comfy if anyone was wondering.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great slip-on shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for the New Balance slip-ons, which are no longer available. I am impressed with the quality and fit. The outer sole is fairly stiff but the insole is soft. It fits a little higher than the New Balance but this means it is less prone to slipping off. The straps at the back are useful for pulling the shoe on and should prevent wearing down the heel box.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Holbrook

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe, except for the suede
customer_reviews.text: I love these Merrill shoes, great fit, sturdily built and comfortable. However, I sent these back because I realized how impractical suede is, at least for me. It’ll look horrible with scrapes and dirt, probably won’t handle water or salt very well. Still a nice shoe, but the material wasn’t aligned with my typical usage needs.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Items arrives on time and size correct, love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love Merrells have been wearing them for 25 years, this particular style "jungle moc" works well for people with a high arch. Other styles rub on top of foot because not high enough, they due tend to run narrow and a little small. Even though I love the shoes, I do have to say looks more like pleather than leather; but still fit great and are sturdy shoes.
customer_reviews.author: digger

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes
customer_reviews.text: My son has been complaining about his back hurting for a couple years. After going to the doctor, trying different shoes, I ordered the Merrell Jungle Mocs after reading all the great reviews. He just called after a day at work to say they were the most amazing shoes ever. His back doesn't hurt after being on his feet eight hours and that's a first. He's asked for another pair for Christmas...even though he did say they are ugly shoes. Comfort trumps beauty!!
customer_reviews.author: Way Down South

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is the first pair of Merrells I've owned. While the fit is true, they are a little snug. However, I can tell they're going to stretch a bit with wear, so I started out with thinner socks. Thicker crew socks work but a little snug. I figure by winter they'll be just fine. I bought these shoes to wear around the house and because they're slip-ons.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Max comfort, but...
customer_reviews.text: These are probably the most comfortable shoes that I own. This is my second pair, as I wore the first pair for about 3 years. They held up extremely well, and are actually just as comfortable today as my new ones. A podiatrist once told me I had "weird feet", so this is a rare treat for me -- to find a shoe that feels like it was custom-made just for me. 18 months later... Still comfortable, but during the past 6 months or so, these Merrell's have developed a loud and persistent squeek, especially bothersome in a quiet room. I'm therefore lowering my overall rating from 5 to 3 stars, as no other shoes I own are this noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Mudhead

customer_reviews.title: The color doesn't match the image at all!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have a very small and rigid opening and are difficult to put on. Moreover, I have ordered a gunsmoke color which in the image has a greenish look, but what I received had no green overtones at all and are simply "greyish". Not what I have expected. I usually wear M to EE size shoes but these were too tight on the sides.
customer_reviews.author: Vazgen Ghazaryan

customer_reviews.title: The raised in-step molded into the shoe is too hard and too high for comfort.
customer_reviews.text: I have very high arches in my feet, and yet the raised support for the in-step in this shoe proved to actually be painful. Not sure the molded sole design in this area or the additional inside support would ever soften enough through use to ever be comfortable for me. I hike some 20 miles per week, so I know a thing or two about how a casual shoe should fit. Have had quality issues with Merrel shoes in the past; a hiking shoe pair lasted about 2 years with the sole de-laminating from the body of the shoe!
customer_reviews.author: D. W. Young

customer_reviews.title: Excellent On Cement
customer_reviews.text: I saw these on a review talking about shoes for standing for long periods of time on concrete. I needed something for the shop because I have tried shoes of every type and price range. It is difficult to describe how comfortable these shoes are and how much longer I can stand and walk on hard surfaces. I even worked a convention, 14 hour days, on my feet for 6 days straight. My feet were tired but not brused lead blocks like before. That being said, they are warm and don’t breathe much. If you can get by that, get a pair. I just wish they came in a polish-able finish.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C. Brien

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of these which I bought at a shoe store. Had them for a long time and still wear them to knock around it but needed a new pair. I found there were more colors available than in the shoe store and they shipped relatively fast considering the COVID problem. Just want to say they are the most comfortable shoe I ever had and the arch support was terrific.
customer_reviews.author: vitocera

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable walking trail shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Love Merrells comfy and great for trail walking with the pup. But, only complaint is the inside lining it doesn't t last long cause I walk in them a lot they back of the shoes are the first to fail but again I am using them a lot...They tend to be tight on arrival and stretch after a couple weeks I use a shoe horn to stretch. I get a 1/2 size bigger than my usual size because I wear thick hiking socks with these. I also put in an extra padded sole as the factory sole is not great. Overall use Merrell for years decent product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike's Review

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I wear these all the time, working retail and receiving wear house, yardwork, path hiking, mountain biking, I love these because they don’t absorb water. I’ve walked through large puddles without problems. If I get my shoes filthy, I just take the hose to the outside of them and wash them off. They are gripy with the exception of wet tile, I’ve slipped twice on wet tile. Other than that, these are great all around shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Thou who should not be named!

customer_reviews.title: Consistent Quality and Comfort!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing this brand and style of shoe for retail work for almost 18 years!! These shoes are not fancy, but every pair has been consistently well made, sturdy, and long-lasting. Now, my eldest son wears the same kind of shoes for work and they eliminated pain he'd had from previous shoes with lesser support.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Too tight - you might want to consider a 1/2 size larger.
customer_reviews.text: I have worn several paris of merrily Jungle Mocs in the past years. But these were surprisingly a bit too tight. Very disappointing. Has Merrill changed their shoe last to manufacture a slightly smaller shoe? Whatever the reason, these were on their way back after a hour of wearing inside the house; my feet were beginning to ache and I had had enough. Too bad; I liked them in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Northwest ELF

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes and the price was right too
customer_reviews.text: First you have to know that I love these shoes and own 5 pairs of them - I have a small hording issue when it comes to getting rid of the old pairs. I use them for work outside and keep the new ones for stepping out on the town. Price, fit and delivery were excellent. I would highly recommend both the product and company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great waterproof shoe
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 12 or 13 depending on the shoe, and for this one I already know that 12 is my size as this is my second pair. For the type of shoe these are they are very comfortable. Once they are broken in they are putting on a slipper. I love how you can just stomp your feet into these without wrecking the back. These will keep your feet warm and dry unless you plan on wearing them for a hot summer day hike, in that case your feet will be wet with sweat :)
customer_reviews.author: The Grither

customer_reviews.title: Great comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are my everyday shoes. I bought this pair to replace the same style shoes I’ve just about worn out. I still use the old shoes for work. The new ones are for other activities. Neither pair needed a break in when new. They fit right, right out of the box. I recommend these shoes if you want comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Pietrzak

customer_reviews.title: perfect fit, comfortable, weatherable
customer_reviews.text: bought these as "slip-on" work shoes that look good, feel good, and can withstand midwest winter weather. Mission accomplished on all parts. excellent traction, easy on, and off, warm and seemingly water and snow proof. And, best of all, I haven't treated them with any toxic spray but no stains from water or salt. Probably get another pair next year.
customer_reviews.author: G. Omer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and comfort
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pair as I have a previous pair that has worn extremely well and wanted a second pair. They are very comfortable and I like the design of the sole as it give traction when walking on hilly damp surfaces. My suggestion is to apply a waterproof suede protector on the shoe when new.
customer_reviews.author: dac

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to walk in.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair. I love them, one of the most comfortable shoes. I where mine everyday to work. I am a Facility Manager. I travel a lot for work and am half in the office and half in the field reviewing my location. Slips on and off easily when I have to go through airport security.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Great support and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are amazing! I've been suffering with a herniated disc in my spine for over 2-3 years and I needed nice and easy comfortable shoes to walk around the house in and around the block. I've gone through many different brands before finding these Merrell slip ones and nothing really compares. These shoes help my back and are comfortable and easy to put on and take off.
customer_reviews.author: J&C Garner

customer_reviews.title: SUCK AS RESTAURANT SHOES
customer_reviews.text: Theses are NOT slip resistant in a restaurant/kitchen. Not even close. I ordered one size bigger and they fit great, they were very comfortable at first, but after one 6 hour shift of sliding around, they felt like they went flat and mu feet, knees, and back killed me. Good as general shoes but SUCK as restaurant shoes
customer_reviews.author: Big Willy

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expect it but it HURTS so much after a couple of hours!!!
customer_reviews.text: I always wear men 9 and most of my regular shoes are supposedly not as comfortable as this shoe, but oh my god this was very disappointed for being very painful and annoying after only a couple of hours with my perfect shoes size! Unfortunately I don’t recommend for people who look for comfortable experience!!!
customer_reviews.author: SEBA James

customer_reviews.title: I haven’t worn them more than once! (Please read review)
customer_reviews.text: My wife ordered these because she hates my older pair which, have seen better days. My older pair are about 4+years old. I wear them every day....every.....day. They are without a doubt the best shoes I have ever worn. I’m still wearing my older pair and have only used my new ones once. I’m sure my older pair will eventually go out....maybe. I also have a pair of mountain boots, water proof mountain boots and the water shoes (chameleon). Greatest shoes you can buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Best arch support I have ever had, wear them everywhere and the most comfortable shoes I own. I have had them over a year and they are still in great shape, with plans to buy another pair when these wear out. They are not the waterproof version and I knew that when I purchased them, so I bought the spray and did it myself and have been very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Tony S

customer_reviews.title: more like 12 - 15 months as they are still comfy
customer_reviews.text: update: bought my 4th and 5th pairs. The build quality still feels great, and my feet just love these things. I could stand in them for hours and feel comfortable. I'm on my 3rd pair in about 4.5 years. I wear them almost daily. After 8 - 10 months the opening has stretched some and the bottoms are slick, but I wear them a little past that if i can, more like 12 - 15 months as they are still comfy. Not stand-all-day comfy, but stand or walk several hours comfy. Also- waterproofness is great. The old pairs get used as my working shoes and are still waterproof. Pretty fantastic shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes that are comfortable and great foot support
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd pair of Merrell slip-on shoes. I used to suffer from plantar fasciitis and during my healing process, these shoes provided the best support and comfort and I believe really helped towards healing my foot issue. While I don't have the foot issue any longer, I got my 2nd pair because the shoes are really comfortable regardless and continue to make sure I have good foot support. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Levinson

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second pair currently. Have been wearing these at work on concrete 8 hours a day. They are comfortable and are not too hot working outside. Only complaint is they only last me about 6-8 months before the soles are completely smooth from walking on the concrete. That is a minor issue for how comfortable they are.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable and awkward arch support.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to these shoes due to the crazy-good reviews, but I'm not happy with them. For a slip-on shoe, it's not quite tight enough (especially for a new shoe) around the opening, and the arch support is awkward. The length of the shoe was a perfect fit, but the arch support felt misplaced (either too much support or the support was at an awkward angle). I knew I'd have a lot of foot pain if I decided to keep them instead of sending them back.
customer_reviews.author: pianobenjjamin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy shoe
customer_reviews.text: This a sturdy shoe that wears well indoors and out. This is the 3rd pair because they’re great. Fit is true to size and leather shapes to your foot a bit. Worn as an everyday shoe to putter around and outdoor activities. only started to come apart And wear out after 18 months. Very easy off and on.
customer_reviews.author: J.Glass

customer_reviews.title: The best as always!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Merrill Jungle mocs since I discovered them in 2000. I probably have half a dozen pairs currently. I don't think you will find a more comfortable shoe. They are durable, waterproof, have great support, easy on/off, and look good. I use them for work, leisure, travel, around town, shoveling snow, you name it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Horton

customer_reviews.title: Great comfortable shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: My second pair of exactly the same shoe I’ve had for many many years. Loved the last pair and love these new ones. Did go up size wise from the last pair but still are just as comfortable. EZ on & EZ off. Soon will need replacement for my black water proof thinsulate lined mocks.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoe for those working on their feet.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional mover and I was looking for a non-slip shoe with excellent fit. I've tried all sorts of other "non-slip" brands, but nearly all failed in wet conditions. These did not. In fact I moved a 400lb upright refrigerator/freezer on soaking wet marble floors without slipping once. Couldn't be happier. The fit is excellent as well. I walk around 6-12 miles a day on the job and I don't feel it at the end of the day in these shoes. My only gripe is that the soles are currently worn out. Completely bald and only after 2 months of use. That's the only reason for 4 stars. But I do use them an absurd ammount
customer_reviews.author: Tdawg

customer_reviews.title: Wear issues over time
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace an exact, older, worn out pair. I really like these Mocs for their comfort and convenience. Problem with this pair is after not quite a year, the right moc has an exposed wrap around inner plastic support piece at the heel which is cutting into the inside of my ankle. Whatever padding on the inside next to the ankle has allowed the plastic to pop through and cause chafing. My old ones never had this problem even after more than a few years of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Lindenwald

customer_reviews.title: Because of the 1st review given, I purchased these.  ( Thank You )
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a pair of these, LL Bean used to make this type of shoe. The new LL Beans do not have the arch or the cushioning in the heel like these do. While I was looking for another pair of mocs for my husband for Christmas I read about these on Amazon. I am so grateful to the wonderful reviews about these Merrell Jungle Mocs. Because of the reviews I purchased them. My husband loves the fact that these mocs have the high arch cushioning and the cushion in the heel. Thank you for the reviews, your help is really appreciated. These mocs remind me of how shoes used to be made.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Winters

customer_reviews.title: Very good fit, very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've had these shoes for a week now. I have no complaints at all. They fit as expected. I have a size 10 D foot - these fit just fine. They do fit snug so they are not prone to flipping off your feet if you pivot or run/jump. I have to take my shoes on and off fairly frequently which is why I've opted for shoes with no laces. I would have purchased these at a brick/mortar store - but they did not have my size in stock. Amazon was slightly more expensive but they have a huge selection. I am very happy with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: CD066

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's Jungle Moc Slip-On Shoe
product_meta.description: Kick back and relax after a long day on the trails with the men’s Jungle Moc from Merrell. Designed with comfort in mind, the men’s Jungle Moc slip-on shoe is versatile enough to wear around the campsite or to the pub. Available in a variety of colors, the Merrell men’s Jungle Moc will coordinate with both your adventure gear and your khakis. When you’re looking for a casual shoe with enough style for a trip into town, this is the perfect fit. Molded nylon arch shank.
feature_bullets: Comfort features like pigskin lining and an Ortholite footbed make this slip-on the perfect everyday companion
Compression molded EVA footframe provides cushioning
Merrell air cushion in the heel absorbs shock and adds stability and breathable mesh lining
